title: How to Sell to Australia
brief_description: Since the beginning of television, Australian advertising has embedded itself into the national psyche through harnessing the moving image. Advertisers haven’t just sold products to Australian audiences, they’ve also built community, spread iconic catchphrases and created beloved characters.

constellations_primary.name: Short films that sell: the power of TV advertising
constellations_primary.description: The MTA’s "Dumb Ways to Die" has over 300 million views on YouTube with the campaign’s song known globally, having charted on iTunes in 28 countries. While light-hearted, at its core the hugely successful commercial carries a serious message: Be Safe Around Trains.

description: Advertising in Australia is unique, innovative and has a language all its own. Since the beginning of television in 1956 to today, Australian advertising has embedded itself into the national psyche by harnessing the power of the moving image. Through animation, live-action and apps, advertisers have been able to not just sell products to Australian audiences but also build community, spread iconic catchphrases and create beloved characters.
